data.title: Famous Jews In Tennis
data.meta_description: A list of famous Jewish tennis players. These 61 Jewish athletes are an inspiration to every Jew & athlete out there, whether you're a fan of Tennis or ...
data.text:
A list of famous Jewish tennis players. These 61 Jewish athletes are an inspiration to every Jew & athlete out there, whether you're a fan of Tennis or just a fan of great athleticism in general. Personally, I'm a fan of both, which is why I've been building this whole series of lists celebrating famous Jewish athletes.

Audra Cohen, a fierce competitor with an aggressive baseline game, has made her mark on tennis history with her precision and determination. Known for her extensive collegiate success, she transitioned smoothly to the professional circuit, quickly earning a reputation as a fierce contender. While her professional career was cut short due to injuries, Cohen's impact on the sport is undeniable, and she continues to inspire young Jewish tennis players with her tenacity and talent.

Age : 38

Nationality : United States of America

Dudi Sela's journey from a humble beginning in Israel to a prominent figure on the tennis circuit speaks volumes about his unwavering dedication and passion for the sport. With a quick, aggressive style of play, Sela has amassed numerous singles and doubles titles, consistently representing Israel on the international stage. His commitment to excellence not only highlights his own success but also serves as an inspiration to countless aspiring Jewish tennis players around the world.

Age : 39

Nationality : Israel

Birthplace : Kiryat Shmona, Israel

Tom Okker

Tom Okker, affectionately nicknamed "The Flying Dutchman," was a force to be reckoned with during his tennis career, thanks to his speed, agility, and versatility on the court. Renowned as both a singles and doubles player, Okker made a lasting impact on the sport through his pioneering tactics and strategies, setting the stage for generations of players to come. His legendary status as one of the best Jewish tennis stars of all time remains unchallenged.

Age : 80

Nationality : Netherlands

Birthplace : Amsterdam, Netherlands

Harold Solomon's name immediately evokes images of perseverance, consistency, and finesse on the tennis court. Embodying the essence of the golden age of American tennis, Solomon's relentless work ethic, coupled with his tactical prowess, elevated him to the highest echelons of tennis greatness. He remains a role model for Jewish athletes everywhere, reminding us all that hard work and dedication can overcome any obstacle.

Age : 71

Nationality : United States of America

Birthplace : Washington, D.C.

Brad Gilbert, a master tactician and strategist, made a lasting impact on tennis not only through his own playing career but also as a respected coach. Known for his ability to outwit and outlast opponents, Gilbert's unique approach to the game came to fruition with consistent success on the professional circuit. As a mentor to some of tennis's finest players, Gilbert continues to shape the sport's landscape through his coaching prowess and keen understanding of the game.

Age : 63

Nationality : United States of America

Birthplace : Oakland, California

Nicolás Massú, the tireless Chilean warrior, is known for his relentless spirit and tenacity on the court. With nimble footwork and a fearless approach to the game, Massú carved out a place for himself amongst the elite of the tennis world. He remains an inspiration to Jewish tennis players, instilling the values of perseverance and determination to future generations.

Age : 44

Nationality : Chile

Birthplace : Viña del Mar, Chile
